title: OOM reboot loop
body:
c2e0abce2eedc1ba2a1b32c46fd07ef18a25354a
```
Geth
Version: 1.11.0-unstable
Git Commit: c2e0abce2eedc1ba2a1b32c46fd07ef18a25354a
Git Commit Date: 20221117
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.19.3
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=
```
Args
```
        "Args": [
            "--datadir=/root/.ethereum",
            "--config=/root/.ethereum/geth.toml",
            "--maxpeers=500",
            "--light.maxpeers=256",
            "--light.serve=50",
            "--nat=extip:104************",
            "--nodekey=/root/.ethereum/node.key",
            "--port=30303",
            "--verbosity=3",
            "--ethstats=****************@ethstats.dev",
            "--metrics",
            "--pprof",
            "--pprof.addr=0.0.0.0",
            "--metrics.influxdb",
            "--metrics.influxdb.database=metrics",
            "--metrics.influxdb.tags=***************",
            "--metrics.influxdb.endpoint=https://g***************/",
            "--metrics.influxdb.username=***************",
            "--metrics.influxdb.password=***************",
            "--authrpc.addr=0.0.0.0",
            "--authrpc.vhosts=*",
            "--authrpc.jwtsecret=/execution-auth.jwt"

```
Crash
```

```

The syslog had filled with ~25Gb of these types of messages: 
```
Nov 18 00:09:34 bootnode-azure-westus-001 dockerd[1668]: time="2022-11-18T00:09:34.250423277Z" level=warning msg="got error while decoding json" error="unexpected EOF" retries=8415
```
Not sure what cause that, but it did fill the root partition. After the root partition was full, I guess that somehow spilled over on the available (swap?) memory allocatable, and caused geth OOM. 

I have cleared the space now, and done an `apt upgrade`, so hopefully the problem is gone. In any case, I don't think the error is in geth.
